name: Chikuwa Isobeage
description: Chikuwa Isobeage‚Äîfried fish cakes coated with tempura batter‚Äîare a classic pub food in Japan. With a crispy exterior and deliciously chewy texture, they make the best snack or side to go with anything! Only 5 ingredients needed.

itemListElement.text: In a medium bowl, combine the 4 Tbsp all-purpose flour (plain flour), 2 tsp aonori (dried green laver seaweed), and ¬Ω tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt. Mix well with chopsticks.
itemListElement.name: In a medium bowl, combine the 4 Tbsp all-purpose flour (plain flour), 2 tsp aonori (dried green laver seaweed), and ¬Ω tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt. Mix well with chopsticks.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add 4 Tbsp water to the dry ingredients and roughly mix with chopsticks. We do not want to activate the gluten in the batter, so do not overmix. It‚Äòs okay to have lumps in the batter.
itemListElement.name: Gradually add 4 Tbsp water to the dry ingredients and roughly mix with chopsticks. We do not want to activate the gluten in the batter, so do not overmix. It‚Äòs okay to have lumps in the batter.

itemListElement.text: Cut 5 pieces chikuwa (fish cake) in half lengthwise. If you‚Äòd like, cut each piece again crosswise in half or thirds.
itemListElement.name: Cut 5 pieces chikuwa (fish cake) in half lengthwise. If you‚Äòd like, cut each piece again crosswise in half or thirds.

itemListElement.text: Add the chikuwa to the batter and coat well.
itemListElement.name: Add the chikuwa to the batter and coat well.

itemListElement.text: In a large frying pan, heat ¬Ω cup neutral oil on medium heat. When it‚Äòs hot, place the battered chikuwa in the pan. Do not crowd.
itemListElement.name: In a large frying pan, heat ¬Ω cup neutral oil on medium heat. When it‚Äòs hot, place the battered chikuwa in the pan. Do not crowd.

itemListElement.text: Shallow-fry until the bottom side is nice golden brown, then flip to cook the other side. Fry for roughly 1 minute on each side as the chikuwa is already cooked. Drain the excess oil on a paper towel or wire rack and serve immediately. I also like to sprinkle with sea salt flakes to intensify the flavor.
itemListElement.name: Shallow-fry until the bottom side is nice golden brown, then flip to cook the other side. Fry for roughly 1 minute on each side as the chikuwa is already cooked. Drain the excess oil on a paper towel or wire rack and serve immediately. I also like to sprinkle with sea salt flakes to intensify the flavor.

itemListElement.text: You can store the leftovers in an airtight container and store them in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and in the freezer for 2 weeks. I recommend reheating them in the oven or toaster oven for a crispy texture.
itemListElement.name: You can store the leftovers in an airtight container and store them in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and in the freezer for 2 weeks. I recommend reheating them in the oven or toaster oven for a crispy texture.

review.reviewBody: This recipe is awesome! It doesn't take long at all. It's even easy to memorize. Even with the chikuwa frozen I was able to just run them under hot water for a few minutes to thaw and pat them dry, ready to go! Quick and easy snacks for a fun night. Me and my boyfriend took a break halfway through our game of Koi Koi and had these snacks with some Asahi Dry beer! It was a nice night!

Thank you so much for your wonderful recipes! üíï üíêThey are helping me to become a better cook while keeping my connection to Japan alive. So, I am overjoyed by your generosity, and celebrating with healthy and delicious Japanese food! üç±üç°üçòü•óüçµüíêüíï
